General Provisions.name: Building Codes/Standards Applicable to All Constructions
General Provisions.description: Is there a National Building Code and/or a unified set of building standards applicable to all construction in the measured economy?

General Provisions.name: Legally adopted building design regulations
General Provisions.description: The country has a legally adopted building regulation than contains some design provisions.

General Provisions.name: Building code coverage: private buildings
General Provisions.description: The building code has some provisions related to the design and construction of private buildings in the country.

General Provisions.name: Building code coverage: public buildings
General Provisions.description: The building code has some provisions related to the design and construction of public buildings in the country.

General Provisions.name: Building code coverage: vernacular buildings
General Provisions.description: The building code has some provisions related to the design and construction of buildings using vernacular methods in the country.

General Provisions.name: Provisions for existing buildings: alterations or repairs
General Provisions.description: The building code has some proviions related to minor alterations and/or repairs for existing buildings.

General Provisions.name: Provisions for existing buildings: change of occupancy
General Provisions.description: The building code has some provisions for change of occupancy of existing buildings.

General Provisions.name: Provisions for existing buildings: additional floors or spaces
General Provisions.description: The building code has some provisions for building additions to existing buildings (additional floors or spaces).

General Provisions.name: Simplified design rules for small scale buildings (or “rules of thumb”)
General Provisions.description: Simplified provisions for certain types of small-scale buildings are permitted_x000D_by the code and these design rules are included in the building regulation document.

Structural Resilience.name: Countries with a building code integrating aspects related with structural strength (materials to be used, such as wood, concrete, tubular or masonry)
Structural Resilience.description: Please indicate whether the National Building Code and/or a unified set of building standards provide clear provisions or guidelines for each of the following: - 5. Structural strength (materials to be used, such as wood, concrete, tubular or masonry)

Structural Resilience.name: Countries with a building code integrating Soil testing requirements according to certain criteria (eg - based on classification, strength, compressibility of soil)
Structural Resilience.description: Please indicate whether the National Building Code and/or a unified set of building standards provide clear provisions or guidelines for each of the following: - 4. Soil testing requirements according to certain criteria (eg - based on classification, strength, compressibility of soil)

Structural Resilience.name: Wind actions
Structural Resilience.description: The building code contains some provisions related to wind loading actions.

Structural Resilience.name: Seismic actions
Structural Resilience.description: The building code contains some provisions related to seismic loading actions.

Structural Resilience.name: Structural design
Structural Resilience.description: The building code contains some provisions for structural design.

Structural Resilience.name: Geotechnical design
Structural Resilience.description: The building code contains some provisions for geotechnical design aspects.

Structural Resilience.name: Material requirements
Structural Resilience.description: The building code contains some provisions related to material specific requirements (e.g., minimum strength requirements and/or detailing of structural materials).

Structural Resilience.name: Provisions for construction materials: masonry (unreinforced)
Structural Resilience.description: The building code contains some provisions related to the design of unreinforced masonry.

Structural Resilience.name: Provisions for construction materials: masonry (reinforced)
Structural Resilience.description: The building code contains some provisions related to the design of reinforced masonry.

Structural Resilience.name: Provisions for construction materials: reinforced concrete (cast in place)
Structural Resilience.description: The building code contains some provisions related to the design of cast in place reinforced concrete.

Structural Resilience.name: Provisions for construction materials: reinforced concrete (pre-cast)
Structural Resilience.description: The building code contains some provisions related to the design of pre-cast concrete.

Structural Resilience.name: Provisions for construction materials: steel
Structural Resilience.description: The building code contains some provisions related to the design of structural steel.

Structural Resilience.name: Provisions for construction materials: adobe or rammed earth
Structural Resilience.description: The building code contains some provisions related to the design of adobe or rammed earth.

Structural Resilience.name: Provisions for construction materials: timber
Structural Resilience.description: The building code contains some provisions related to the design of timber structures.

Structural Resilience.name: Mandated material testing for construction materials
Structural Resilience.description: The building code contains some provisions related to mandatory testing of construction materials.

Structural Resilience.name: Procedure to develop design wind loading
Structural Resilience.description: The code contains a procedure to determine wind loading, with at least some partial information required to perform wind design for a specific building (for example, a procedure which includes some elements todevelop the level of wind loads based on the location, exposure and soforth, and/or specifies type and level of design wind speeds for a site).

Structural Resilience.name: Country-specific wind- loading design criteria
Structural Resilience.description: The code contains country-specific wind design criteria for a site (for example, _x000D_country, region or city specific wind speed maps).

Structural Resilience.name: Simplified wind-loading design procedures
Structural Resilience.description: The effect of wind (suction or pressure) is simulated as static wind pressure _x000D_for the design of structural and nonstructural elements and their connections.

Structural Resilience.name: Wind importance factors
Structural Resilience.description: Importance of different buildings based on their occupancy/function (for _x000D_example, importance factor) is considered in the design for wind.

Structural Resilience.name: Wind design procedure for tall buildings
Structural Resilience.description: Dynamic effects of wind are considered in the design of tall buildings_x000D_ according to the code-prescribed procedure.

Structural Resilience.name: Wind design provisions for roof cladding and roof overhangs
Structural Resilience.description: Requirements to design roof cladding and roof overhangs to resist strong _x000D_winds. These could also include provisions related to roof shape.

Structural Resilience.name: Wind design of wall cladding and nonstructural appendages
Structural Resilience.description: Requirements to design nonstructural cladding and appendages (cladding,_x000D_ gutters, equipment, and so on) to resist strong winds.

Structural Resilience.name: Wind design of façade - wind bourne debris
Structural Resilience.description: Requirements to design façade to resist damage from wind- borne debris.

Structural Resilience.name: Wind design façade detailing - water ingress
Structural Resilience.description: Requirements to detail façade to resist water ingress during a strong wind event.

Structural Resilience.name: Detailing of doors and door mechanisms for strong winds
Structural Resilience.description: Requirements to detail doors and door mechanisms to resist strong winds.

Structural Resilience.name: Procedure for seismic design criteria
Structural Resilience.description: The code contains a procedure to determine seismic design parameters, with at least some partial information required to perform seismic design for a specific building (for example, a procedure that specifies some elements which may include the level of design seismic hazard for a specific site and/or a procedure to determine the design level of seismic base shear).

Structural Resilience.name: Country specific seismic criteria
Structural Resilience.description: The code contains country-specific seismic hazard parameters for design (for example, seismic hazard maps, seismic zonation maps or other seismic criteria parameters by site location or city, region, and so on).

Structural Resilience.name: Consideration of soil effects in seismic design criteria
Structural Resilience.description: Effect of soil conditions is considered in seismic analysis/design according to the code.

Structural Resilience.name: Seismic importance factors
Structural Resilience.description: The importance of different buildings in a post-earthquake situation is _x000D_considered based on their occupancy/function (for example, importance_x000D_ category).

Structural Resilience.name: Simplified seismic analysis procedures_x000D_ (for example, equivalent static)
Structural Resilience.description: A procedure to perform Equivalent Static Seismic Analysis is included in _x000D_the code.

Structural Resilience.name: Dynamic seismic analysis procedures_x000D_ (for example, response spectra,_x000D_ response time history analysis)
Structural Resilience.description: Procedures to perform dynamic analysis, for example, Response Spectra _x000D_(multimodal) analysis and/or response history analysis, are included in the_x000D_ code and are required in some cases.

Structural Resilience.name: Nonlinear static seismic analysis _x000D_procedures (for example, pushover)
Structural Resilience.description: A procedure to perform nonlinear static seismic analysis (pushover analysis)_x000D_ is included in the code.

Structural Resilience.name: Seismic ductility requirements and factors
Structural Resilience.description: Seismic force modification factors are prescribed for reinforced concrete and structural steel systems which are expected to be designed to perform at different ductility levels.

Structural Resilience.name: Seismic drift limits
Structural Resilience.description: Lateral displacement limits (for example, maximum inter-story displacement/drift) are prescribed for different buildings depending on their importance category.

Structural Resilience.name: Seismic design requirements related to building regularity (vertical and horizontal)
Structural Resilience.description: Provisions regarding  the seismic analysis/design of structures with horizontal (plan)_x000D_ and vertical (elevation) irregularities are included in the code.

Structural Resilience.name: Seismic design: diaphragm design
Structural Resilience.description: Some provisions for seismic design of floor diaphragms are included (for example, these could include diaphragm material specific provisions (concrete/steel/timber), design forces, diaphragm stiffness considerations, collector and connection forces, anchorage of walls).

Structural Resilience.name: Seismic design: advanced systems (base isolation, added damping systems, and so on)
Structural Resilience.description: Seismic analysis and design provisions for structures equipped with base isolation _x000D_devices and/or supplemental damping systems are included.

Structural Resilience.name: Seismic design: non structural components
Structural Resilience.description: Some provisions for seismic design of nonstructural components are included in the code (such as for the façade/building envelope; parapets; nonstructural/infill walls; mechanical, electrical, plumbing—MEP—equipment).

Structural Resilience.name: Ductile detailing of lateral resisting systems: concrete moment frames
Structural Resilience.description: Seismic design provisions that ensure ductile seismic performance of concrete moment frames - medium and/or high ductility (also called intermediate and/or special). For example, the Capacity Design approach and/or prescriptive requirements that ensure ductile behavior are included in the code.

Structural Resilience.name: Ductile detailing of lateral resisting systems: concrete shear wall
Structural Resilience.description: Seismic design provisions that ensure ductile seismic performance of concrete shear wall - medium and/or high ductility. For example, the Capacity Design approach and/or prescriptive requirements that ensure ductile behavior are included in the code.

Structural Resilience.name: Ductile detailing of lateral resisting systems: steel moment resisting frames
Structural Resilience.description: Seismic design provisions that ensure ductile seismic performance of steel moment resisting frames - medium and/or high ductility (also _x000D_called ordinary and/or special). For example, the Capacity Design approach and/or prescriptive requirements that ensure ductile behavior are included in the code.

Structural Resilience.name: Ductile detailing of lateral resisting systems: steel braced frame systems
Structural Resilience.description: Seismic design provisions that ensure ductile seismic performance of steel braced frame systems (concentric, eccentric and/or buckling_x000D_restrained brace frame). For example, the Capacity Design approach and/or prescriptive requirements that ensure ductile behavior are included in the code.

Structural Resilience.name: Ductile detailing of lateral resisting systems: confined masonry systems
Structural Resilience.description: Seismic design provisions that ensure ductile seismic performance of confined masonry systems. For example, the Capacity Design approach and/or prescriptive requirements that ensure ductile behavior are included in the code.

Structural Resilience.name: Ductile detailing of lateral resisting systems: timber lateral resisting systems
Structural Resilience.description: Seismic design provisions that ensure ductile seismic performance of timber lateral resisting systems (nailed plywood shear walls and/or_x000D_ other types). For example, the Capacity Design approach and/or prescriptive requirements that ensure ductile behavior are included in the code.

Structural Resilience.name: Ductile detailing of lateral resisting systems: masonry systems
Structural Resilience.description: Seismic design provisions that ensure ductile seismic performance of masonry systems. For example, the Capacity Design approach and/or prescriptive requirements that ensure ductile behavior are included in the code.

Structural Resilience.name: Provisions for seismic assessment_x000D_ and retrofit of existing buildings
Structural Resilience.description: The code includes provisions related to seismic assessment and retrofit of_x000D_ existing buildings.

Structural Resilience.name: Load procedure for flood loading
Structural Resilience.description: Provisions for determining loading from flooding, and/or storm surge.

Structural Resilience.name: Design for flooding: higher level evacuation areas
Structural Resilience.description: Requirements for higher level evacuation areas for building occupants (for _x000D_example roof access, balconies) in case of a flood event.

Structural Resilience.name: Limitations on occupied zones below the design flood level
Structural Resilience.description: Provisions that limit or prohibit occupied zones below the design flood_x000D_ level.

Structural Resilience.name: Design for flooding: critical equipment and services
Structural Resilience.description: Requirements to locate critical equipment and/or services above design_x000D_ flood level.

Structural Resilience.name: Design for flooding: structural and nonstructural materials
Structural Resilience.description: Provisions related to structural and nonstructural material requirements in_x000D_ relation to flooding.

Structural Resilience.name: Design for flooding: vents, valves or other wall openings
Structural Resilience.description: Requirements for the design of vents, valves or other openings in the walls _x000D_of enclosed spaces below the design flood level to equalize lateral water_x000D_ pressures.

Structural Resilience.name: Site investigation
Structural Resilience.description: The codes includes provisions for performing geotechnical site investigations and, in some cases, the code requires site investigation to be carried out.

Structural Resilience.name: Design of foundations
Structural Resilience.description: Some provisions of the code relate to the design of foundations for buildings (including how to develop foundation design parameters based on soil type, soil data, and so on).

Structural Resilience.name: Design of retaining walls
Structural Resilience.description: Some provisions relate to the design of retaining walls for buildings (including how to develop retaining wall design parameters based on soil type, soil data,and so on).

Structural Resilience.name: Dead and live loading
Structural Resilience.description: Provisions for determining dead loads and minimum live loads are included in the code.

Structural Resilience.name: Load combinations
Structural Resilience.description: The building regulation document contains load combinations for all applicable loads and materials that are covered within the document.

Structural Resilience.name: Provisions for construction materials: reinforced concrete
Structural Resilience.description: Some structural design provisions are in place for reinforced concrete.

Structural Resilience.name: Provisions for construction materials: pre-cast concrete
Structural Resilience.description: Some structural design provisions are in place for pre-cast concrete.

Structural Resilience.name: Provisions for construction materials: structural steel
Structural Resilience.description: Some structural design provisions are in place for structural steel.

Structural Resilience.name: Provisions for construction materials: reinforced masonry and/or reinforced grouted hollow block masonry
Structural Resilience.description: Some structural design provisions are in place for reinforced masonry and/or reinforced grouted hollow block masonry.

Structural Resilience.name: Provisions for construction materials: confined masonry
Structural Resilience.description: Some structural design provisions are in place for confined masonry.

Structural Resilience.name: Provisions for construction materials: unreinforced masonry (hollow block and/or brick and/or stone)
Structural Resilience.description: Some structural design provisions are in place for unreinforced masonry (hollow block and/or brick and/or stone).

Structural Resilience.name: Provisions for construction materials: timber
Structural Resilience.description: Some structural design provisions are in place for timber.

Structural Resilience.name: Provisions for construction materials: earth (including adobe, soil stabilized block, rammed earth, and so on)
Structural Resilience.description: Some structural design provisions are in place for earth (including adobe, soil stabilized block, rammed earth, and so on)

Structural Resilience.name: Provisions for construction materials: bamboo
Structural Resilience.description: Some structural design provisions are in place for bamboo.

Structural Resilience.name: Minimum material requirements for concrete and reinforcing bars
Structural Resilience.description: The code specifies minimum structural material requirements for reinforced concrete (minimum compressive strength, minimum strength and ductility requirements for reinforcing steel).

Structural Resilience.name: Structural requirements for additions (extensions)
Structural Resilience.description: The code includes some provisions related to structural considerations (including seismic design where applicable) for horizontal and/or vertical building extensions (this may include addressing incremental construction practices).

Structural Resilience.name: Structural requirements for change of occupancy/use
Structural Resilience.description: The code includes some provisions that would prompt consideration of the existing structural system capacity (including seismic design where applicable) when a change of use or occupancy is made.

Structural Resilience.name: Structural assessment
Structural Resilience.description: The code includes provisions related to assessment of the structural condition of existing buildings.

Structural Resilience.name: Provisions for retrofit (including structural changes)
Structural Resilience.description: The code contains some provisions related to building retrofit, including provisions related to structural design of retrofits.

Structural Resilience.name: Countries with natural disaster resistant construction related standards
Structural Resilience.description: Please indicate whether the National Building Code and/or a unified set of building standards provide clear provisions or guidelines for each of the following: - 1. Natural disaster resistant construction (e.g., floods, storms, earthquakes, etc.)

Structural Resilience.name: Flood mitigation
Structural Resilience.description: The building code contains some provisions related to flood mitigation.

Structural Resilience.name: Landslides
Structural Resilience.description: The building code contains some provisions related to landslides.

Building Classification.name: Countries with a building code integrating building classification according to certain criteria (e.g., usage; size)
Building Classification.description: Please indicate whether the National Building Code and/or a unified set of building standards provide clear provisions or guidelines for each of the following: - 2. Building classification according to certain criteria (e.g., usage; size)

Building Classification.name: Use and occupancy classifications
Building Classification.description: The building code contains some provisions related to use and occupancy classifications.

Building Classification.name: Height and areas limitations based on the type of construction
Building Classification.description: The building code contains some provisions related to height and areas limitations based on the type of construction.

Building Classification.name: Special considerations for certain building types
Building Classification.description: The building code contains some provisions related to special design considerations for certain building types.

Building Classification.name: Importance or risk classification of buildings
Building Classification.description: The code contains importance and/or risk classification of buildings (sometimesalso called consequence classes).

Fire Safety.name: Countries with a building code integrating active and passive fire safety measures
Fire Safety.description: Please indicate whether the National Building Code and/or a unified set of building standards provide clear provisions or guidelines for each of the following: - 3. Active and passive fire safety measures

Fire Safety.name: Fire resistance performance requirements
Fire Safety.description: The building code has some provisions related to fire resistance performance requirements.

Fire Safety.name: Means of access and egress
Fire Safety.description: The building code has some provisions related to means of egress and access in case of fire.

Fire Safety.name: Fire prevention
Fire Safety.description: The building code has some provisions related to fire prevention.

Fire Safety.name: Fire service access
Fire Safety.description: The building code has some provisions related to fire service access.

Fire Safety.name: Fire resistance of structural elements
Fire Safety.description: Some provisions related to fire resistance of the main structural elements are included in the code.

Universal Accessibility.name: Accessibility and inclusivity standard applicable to all construction
Access route and means
Universal Accessibility.description: The building code has some provisions related to access routes and means for people of all ages and abilities.

Universal Accessibility.name: Fixtures and signals
Universal Accessibility.description: The building code has some provisions related to design of fixtures and signals for people of all ages and abilities.

Universal Accessibility.name: Accessibility and usability of internal facilities
Universal Accessibility.description: The building code has some provisions related to accessibility and usability of internal facilities for people of all ages and abilities.

Universal Accessibility.name: External environment
Universal Accessibility.description: External environment (for example, approach to building entrance, circulation routes, and so on). The regulation document contains some provisions on universal accessibility requirements related to the external environment.

Universal Accessibility.name: Entrances, doors, and lobbies
Universal Accessibility.description: The regulation document contains some provisions related to universal_x000D_ accessibility requirements for entrances, doors and/or lobbies.

Universal Accessibility.name: Horizontal and vertical circulation within a building
Universal Accessibility.description: The regulation document contains some provisions related to universal_x000D_ accessibility requirements for horizontal and vertical circulation.

Universal Accessibility.name: Building facilities
Universal Accessibility.description: The regulation document contains some provisions related to universal_x000D_ accessibility requirements for building facilities, including WC/toilets.

Universal Accessibility.name: Building fixtures and fittings to assist_x000D_ with orientation, wayfinding, and_x000D_ communication
Universal Accessibility.description: The regulation document contains some provisions related to universal_x000D_ accessibility requirements for building fixtures and fittings.

Universal Accessibility.name: Evacuation and safe egress
Universal Accessibility.description: The regulation document contains some provisions related to universal_x000D_ accessibility requirements for evacuation and safe egress.

Green Buildings.name: Are there legally required minimum energy efficiency performance standards in the building code or any other building regulations?
Green Buildings.description: Are there legally required minimum energy efficiency performance standards in the building code or any other building regulations?

Green Buildings.name: Is proof of compliance with energy efficiency standards included as a precondition for obtaining a building permit?
Green Buildings.description: Is proof of compliance with energy efficiency standards included as a precondition for obtaining a building permit?

Green Buildings.name: Thermal transmittance or insulation calculations for building envelopes are verified as part of the energy efficiency performance standards
Green Buildings.description: Please indicate which elements of the energy efficiency performance standards are verified as part of the building plans review process? - 1. Thermal transmittance or insulation calculations for building envelopes

Green Buildings.name: Solar heat gain calculations for building envelope are verified as part of the energy efficiency performance standards
Green Buildings.description: Please indicate which elements of the energy efficiency performance standards are verified as part of the building plans review process? - 2. Solar heat gain calculations for building envelope

Green Buildings.name: Glazing factors for fenestration are verified as part of the energy efficiency performance standards
Green Buildings.description: Please indicate which elements of the energy efficiency performance standards are verified as part of the building plans review process? - 3. Glazing factors for fenestration

Green Buildings.name: Heating/cooling demand calculations are verified as part of the energy efficiency performance standards
Green Buildings.description: Please indicate which elements of the energy efficiency performance standards are verified as part of the building plans review process? - 4. Heating/cooling demand calculations

Green Buildings.name: Daylighting and orientation are verified as part of the energy efficiency performance standards
Green Buildings.description: Please indicate which elements of the energy efficiency performance standards are verified as part of the building plans review process? - 5. Daylighting and orientation

Green Buildings.name: Permanent shading are verified as part of the energy efficiency performance standards
Green Buildings.description: Please indicate which elements of the energy efficiency performance standards are verified as part of the building plans review process? - 6. Permanent shading

Green Buildings.name: Air barrier, air leakage or air infiltration are verified as part of the energy efficiency performance standards
Green Buildings.description: Please indicate which elements of the energy efficiency performance standards are verified as part of the building plans review process? - 7. Air barrier, air leakage or air infiltration

Green Buildings.name: Required minimum efficiency of heating and cooling equipment and controls standards are verified as part of the energy efficiency performance standards
Green Buildings.description: Please indicate which elements of the energy efficiency performance standards are verified as part of the building plans review process? - 8. Efficiency of heating and cooling equipment and controls

Green Buildings.name: Required minimum standards for efficiency of water heating equipment and controls are verified as part of the energy efficiency performance standards
Green Buildings.description: Please indicate which elements of the energy efficiency performance standards are verified as part of the building plans review process? - 9. Efficiency of water heating equipment and controls

Green Buildings.name: Efficiency of lighting fixtures and controls are verified as part of the energy efficiency performance standards
Green Buildings.description: Please indicate which elements of the energy efficiency performance standards are verified as part of the building plans review process? - 10. Efficiency of lighting fixtures and controls

Green Buildings.name: Are there any incentives provided to builders in order to promote green building standards?
Green Buildings.description: Are there any incentives provided to builders in order to promote green building standards?

Green Buildings.name: Natural Insulation and ventilation
Green Buildings.description: The building code contains some provisions related to natural insulation and ventilation.

Green Buildings.name: Green building construction material
Green Buildings.description: The building code contains some provisions related to construction materials which are more sustainable and meet green building requirements.

Green Buildings.name: Energy and water efficient design methods
Green Buildings.description: The building code contains some provisions related to energy and water efficient design requirements.

Green Buildings.name: Carbon smart/neutral construction
Green Buildings.description: The building code contains some provisions related to carbon smart/neutral construction.

Green Buildings.name: Building orientation
Green Buildings.description: Orientating the building to optimize the level of direct heat from sunlight entering the building. The regulation includes some voluntary provisions on building orientation to_x000D_ control solar heat gain and/or improve natural ventilation.

Green Buildings.name: Daylighting
Green Buildings.description: The regulation includes some voluntary provisions on building orientation to control solar heat gain and/or improve natural ventilation. The regulation document specifies voluntary or mandatory provisions related _x000D_to daylighting (for example, that a certain percentage of habitable building_x000D_ area must be adequately lit through daylight).

Green Buildings.name: Natural ventilation
Green Buildings.description: Natural ventilation to provide fresh air indoors and support cooling. The regulation document contains provisions which require a certain amount of operable window, glazing, or perforation area with respect to the room’s usable floor area.

Green Buildings.name: Solar shading
Green Buildings.description: External solar shading to control solar heat gain. The regulation document provides guidance on various types of shading_x000D_ elements and related design provisions (voluntary or mandatory).

Green Buildings.name: Insulation of walls, roofs and windows _x000D_(U-value requirements)
Green Buildings.description: Insulation of walls, roofs and windows to stop over-heating in hot weather and heat loss in cold weather. The regulation documents specify mandatory U-value requirements for the_x000D_ walls, roofs and/or window assemblies.

Green Buildings.name: Window-to-Wall Ratio (WWR)
Green Buildings.description: Window-to-Wall Ratio (WWR) requirements to balance the need for light and ventilation with the amount of solar heat gain from glazed areas. The regulation documents have mandatory provisions related to WWRs (and_x000D_provide a formula to calculate WWR). These can include requirements for _x000D_minimum or maximum WWR and/or different WWRs for differently oriented_x000D_ walls.

Green Buildings.name: Reflective walls and roofs
Green Buildings.description: Reflective walls and roofs to reduce solar heat gain. The regulations specify mandatory solar reflectance index (SRI) values for_x000D_ walls and/or roofs.

Green Buildings.name: Green walls and roofs
Green Buildings.description: Green walls or roofs to cool buildings both externally and internally. The regulations document addresses their design and construction. If the provisions are mandatory, they may include minimum standard for such roofs and walls in terms of area covered by vegetation.

Green Buildings.name: Energy efficient lighting
Green Buildings.description: Energy efficient lighting (for example, LEDs, light sensors, and so on). The regulation document specifies light power density for various types of_x000D_buildings and/or a minimum level of lumens per watt for lighting fixtures _x000D_and/or requirements for sensors such as daylight sensors and/or occupancy_x000D_ sensors to control the use of lighting depending on user needs.

Green Buildings.name: Energy-efficient Heating Ventilation_x000D_ and Air Conditioning (HVAC) systems
Green Buildings.description: Energy-efficient heating ventilation and air conditioning (HVAC) mechanical systems. The regulation document contains some mandatory provisions related to measures to improve energy efficiency of HVAC systems and other equipment. These could include requirements for pipe and duct insulation, ceiling fans, air economizers, setting a minimum coefficient of performance for air conditioning and/or heating equipment, heat recovery from return air and/or requirements for variable frequency drives.

Green Buildings.name: Renewable energy
Green Buildings.description: Renewable methods to supply the building with energy (for example, solar panels, geothermal). The regulation document includes some provisions related to onsite generation of electricity through solar power or wind and/or connection to a grid that provides off-site renewable energy (voluntary or mandatory).

Green Buildings.name: Water-efficient fixtures and fittings
Green Buildings.description: Water-efficient fixtures and fittings (for example, low-flow toilets, taps, and so on). The regulation document includes mandatory provisions related to water-efficient fixtures and fittings. For example, it may specify flow rates by type of fixture or fitting (for example, faucets, showers, toilets).

Green Buildings.name: Water collection/water re-use
Green Buildings.description: Water collection/water re-use (for example, rainwater harvesting, use of grey water for certain functions). The regulation document includes some voluntary or mandatory provisions_x000D_for this (for example, condensate recovery, rainwater harvesting, re-use of_x000D_ treated water for potable and nonpotable uses).

Green Buildings.name: Recycled building materials
Green Buildings.description: Recycled building materials (for example, requirements for a building to use recycled materials and/or be recyclable). The regulation document specifies a mandatory percentage of building materials to be made of recycled materials.

Green Buildings.name: Low embodied energy materials
Green Buildings.description: Low embodied energy materials (for example, materials with lower carbon footprints). The regulation document encourages or prescribes the use of low embodied energy materials and/or gives guidance on how to calculate the carbon footprint of the building materials and optimize building material used to reduce the carbon footprint.

Green Buildings.name: Country (Official WB name)
Green Buildings.description: Katherine: There doesn't seem to be a clear detailed descriptive of the data (beyond the indicator name). Confirm with Jayashree's team.

Third Party Enforcement System: A description of the procedure to authorize third-party inspectors
Third Party Enforcement System: A description of the professional qualifications required to register as a third-party inspector
Third Party Enforcement System: Establish an independent body charged with developing guidelines, standards and/or codes of conduct for third-party inspectors
Third Party Enforcement System: Establish a supervisory body to ensure third-party inspections are conducted appropriately and without conflict of interest
Design Compliance Components: Checklist of Passive Design Features
Design Compliance Components: Energy Verification Worksheets
Design Compliance Components: Lighting Plans and Schedules

Building Plan Review Components: Solar heat gain calculations for building envelope

Building Control.name: Established building control processes
Building Control.description: The building control processes are clearly defined in any regulations or government documents with a complete_x000D_ and detailed framework_x000D_ defining the building_x000D_ control processes.

Building Control.name: Optimized process
Building Control.description: The building control process integrates a tiered system of building categories to determine application requirements and allocate human resources. There is a clear categorization system within the building control regulations that introduces clearly differentiated requirements and processes for different categories of buildings based on parameters such as height, total size, and so forth.

Building Control.name: Defined building _x000D_inspection _x000D_framework
Building Control.description: The building control framework integrates inspections by the authority in charge during the construction process. In particular, regulations have defined a clear inspections framework, setting out who is in charge of site visits and when, with responsibilities clearly stated.
